text: It (also known as It: Chapter One) is a 2017 American supernatural horror movie based Stephen King's 1986 novel of the same name and directed by Andy Muschietti, produced by KatzSmith Productions, Lin Pictures, and Vertigo Entertainment, and distributed by Warner Bros. and New Line Cinema It is the highest-grossing horror movie in history with $677.6 million in the box office, beating The Sixth Sense with $672.8 million. ==Background== It is the first installment in a planned duology, as well as being the second adaptation following Tommy Lee Wallace's It (1990) miniseries. In June 2016, Bill Skarsgård was cast as the villain Pennywise the Dancing Clown after another actor, Will Poulter, dropped out due to other projects. ==Plot== The movie tells the story of seven children in Detroit, Michigan who are terrorized by Pennywise the Clown, only to face their own personal demons in the process. ==Release== It was released on September 8, 2017 in the United States. The movie made $13.5 million from Thursday night previews, setting the record for highest amount by both an R-rated (beating Deadpools $12.6 million) and a horror movie. The movie was released to positive reviews and has an 86% on Rotten Tomatoes based on 203 reviews, with an average rating of 7.2/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "Well-acted and fiendishly frightening with an emotionally affecting story at its core, It amplifies the horror in Stephen King's classic story without losing touch with its heart." ==Sequels and adaptations== A sequel, It – Chapter Two, was released in 2019. ==Awards== List of awards and nominations Award Date of ceremony Category Recipient(s) and nominee(s) Result Golden Trailer Awards June 6, 2017 Best Horror It ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * * Category:2017 horror movies Category:2017 drama thriller movies Category:2010s horror thriller movies Category:2010s supernatural movies Category:American drama thriller movies Category:American horror thriller movies Category:American supernatural movies Category:English-language movies Category:Movies based on books Category:Movies set in Maine Category:Movies set in 1988 Category:Warner Bros. movies Category:Movies based on books by Stephen King Category:Movies about children Category:Movies about child death Category:Movies about clowns Category:Movies about puberty Category:Movies about friendship Category:Movies composed by Benjamin Wallfisch
